column5: Hi folks, I'm planning on buying a fly-in fishing trip in Ontario for my brother and husband as a present for next year. Aside from Googling, does anyone have any advice on how to find and compare different outposts other than just going on their individual websites? Many thanks!

Hey there Lots of tips and tricks but my first big one would be to nail down your requirements How far are you willing to travel? What species do you want to fish for What type of accommodations do you need How much are you will to spend per person? In my blog I am actually going to be putting out a full series over the next few weeks on this www.northernjacks.com Cheers Andrew
Is there a particular species they want to target? That might help eliminate?

First off, excellent gift idea.  That's one they won't soon forget.  Lots of information on Mikes's site.  It will help to know where they're starting the journey from?  I've flown with Hearst Air, Luenbergers and Nakina Air and had great trips with all of them.

I agree with both comments that Mike is your go to guy. He helped with so many aspects for the trip that my brother and I took; it wouldn't have happened without Mike's help. He went as far as asking for my phone number, so he could call and ask what we wanted out of our trip. He made his assessment and offered his suggestions. He was right on the money for what we were looking for. He's a no crap guy that will tell you the facts as he knows them. Dan.

I remember my Mom said do a special fishing trip for your Dad's 60th B Day. I spent the winter and scoured the internet and finally choose a spot, our 1st fly in. Looking back, that was 30 fly ins ago for me, lol, it's awesome and addictive. Like others have said, Mike is the guy.
Do read Google reviews not the ones on the outfitters websites.
You'll definitely wanna get in touch with Mr.Borger.
Check out Adam Dempsey's site as well  at https://fishingoutposts.com/ lots of good info to help you make your choice.
